segment.documentation: BGM, A segment identifying the type of chart of accounts.
DTM, A segment containing the date of the opening and closing period of the chart of accounts message, and its preparation date.
RFF, A segment containing the chart of accounts references (type and version number).
CUX, A segment providing currencies which are specific to the chart of accounts message.
FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for the purpose of providing additional clarification.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A segment group giving information on sender, recipient and intermediary.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the sender, recipient or intermediary.
RFF, A segment to provide references which are specific to the concerned party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify contacts and related communication numbers.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to provide contacts related to the party.
COM, A segment to provide communication numbers of the contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to provide accounting features of the chart of accounts and the type of chart of accounts that has been used as reference.

segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify an accounting characteristic of the chart of accounts.
CAV, A segment to provide the value of the above characteristic.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A segment group giving account related information.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment indicating the chart of accounts line number within the message.
CPT, A segment containing detailed information identifying the principal account number (general, subsidiary, analytical or budget account).
FTX, A segment to provide the source of the account and information about the creation of the account.
TAX, A segment used to provide tax related information. Mainly used to provide the tax rate.
DTM, A segment giving detailed information on the opening and closing dates of an account of the chart of accounts message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A segment group used to provide the legal status of the account holder or settlement of an account.

segment.documentation: REL, A segment to identify the relationship between a principal account and other associated entities (sub- account, bank account, etc.).
CPT, A segment containing detailed information identifying the account (general, subsidiary, analytical or budget account) linked to the principal account.
FII, A segment identifying the associated bank account.
PYT, A segment providing associated payment terms.
PAI, A segment specifying instructions related to payment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A segment group to provide legal or accounting characteristics of the account.

segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify a legal or accounting characteristic of an account.
CAV, A segment to provide the value of the above characteristic.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A segment group identify parties related to the account. It may be used to identify the accountant who is in charge of the account in the account holder company.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying the concerned party.
RFF, A segment providing references related to the party. It can be used to provide numbers such as the VAT number of the account holder company.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A segment group to identify contacts and related communication numbers.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to provide contacts related to the party.
COM, A segment to provide communication numbers of the contact.
EQN, A segment specifying the number of accounts in the chart of accounts message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A segment group to provide authentication information.

segment.documentation: AUT, A segment to provide results of the accounting application of an authentication procedure.
DTM, A segment to provide the date of the authentication.
